ctu.nengoros.modules

Interface AsynNeuralModule

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, Node, PeripheralsRegisteringNode, Probeable, Resettable, java.io.Serializable, SimulationMode.ModeConfigurable, VisiblyMutable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MultiTerminationNeuralModule, NeuralModule
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsAsynNeuralModule, AbsNeuralModule, DefaultAsynNeuralModule, DefaultNeuralModule, MultipleInputNeuralModule, NeuralModuleTest

    public interface AsynNeuralModule
extends Node, Probeable, PeripheralsRegisteringNode
    This defines how a NeuralModule should look like. Basically NeuralModule is a Nengo Node, methods createEncoder and createDecoder and add ROS (publisher/listener) and connect it to the Nengo Node terminations/origins. In the constructor of NeuralModule there should be instantiation of Modem, which corresponds to ROS java node, this ROS node is interested in all messages with topics specified in methods createDecoder and createEncoder.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface ca.nengo.util.VisiblyMutable

        VisiblyMutable.Event, VisiblyMutable.Listener, VisiblyMutable.NameChangeEvent, VisiblyMutable.NodeRemovedEvent

    • Method Detail

      • createDecoder

        void createDecoder(java.lang.String topicName,
                 java.lang.String dataType,
                 int[] dimensionSizes)
        Add decoder to the neural module, that is: subscribe to given ROS topic with expected type of data and expected dimensionality. Add origin to the neural module Node in Nengo, with corresponding dimensionality, which produces float values obtained from ROS node. Note: name of ROS node is specified by the Modem instance.
        Parameters:
        topicName - name of the ROS topic
        dataType - type of data ( @See rosjava std_msgs package for more info)
        dimensionSizes - list of dimension sizes (best support only for 1D vectors)

      • createDecoder

        void createDecoder(java.lang.String topicName,
                 java.lang.String dataType,
                 int dimensionSize)

      • createDecoder

        void createDecoder(java.lang.String topicName,
                 java.lang.String dataType)

      • createEncoder

        void createEncoder(java.lang.String topicName,
                 java.lang.String dataType,
                 int[] dimensionSizes)
        Add encoder to the neural module, that is: publish to given ROS topic with given type of data and given dimensionality. Add termination to the neural module Node in Nengo, data of float type received on this termination are then published in form of ROS messages. Note: name of ROS node is specified by the Modem instance.
        Parameters:
        topicName - name of the ROS topic
        dataType - type of data ( @See rosjava std_msgs package for more info)
        dimensionSizes - list of dimension sizes (best support only for 1D vectors)

      • createEncoder

                 java.lang.String dataType,
                 int dimensionSize)
